sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, let's write down the augmented matrix:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & -1 & 5 \\
3 & 2 & 1 & 10 \\
1 & 1 & -1 & 0
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 1: Swap row 1 and row 3 to have a 1 in the top left corner:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 1 & -1 & 0 \\
3 & 2 & 1 & 10 \\
2 & 1 & -1 & 5
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 2: Eliminate the 3 in row 2, column 1 and the 2 in row 3, column 1:

Row 2 = Row 2 - 3 * Row 1
Row 3 = Row 3 - 2 * Row 1

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 1 & -1 & 0 \\
0 & -1 & 4 & 10 \\
0 & -1 & 1 & 5
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 3: Swap row 2 and row 3 to have a non-zero value in the second row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 1 & -1 & 0 \\
0 & -1 & 1 & 5 \\
0 & -1 & 4 & 10
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 4: Eliminate the -1 in row 3, column 2:

Row 3 = Row 3 - Row 2

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 1 & -1 & 0 \\
0 & -1 & 1 & 5 \\
0 & 0 & 3 & 5
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 5: Solve for z:

Row 3: $3z = 5 \Rightarrow z = \frac{5}{3}$

Step 6: Solve for y:

Row 2: $-y + z = 5 \Rightarrow -y + \frac{5}{3} = 5 \Rightarrow y = -\frac{10}{3}$

Step 7: Solve for x:

Row 1: $x + y - z = 0 \Rightarrow x - \frac{10}{3} - \frac{5}{3} = 0 \Rightarrow x = \frac{15}{3} = 5$

So the solution is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z \\
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
5 \\
-\frac{10}{3} \\
\frac{5}{3} \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$
